Diego Rivera's murals are an integral part of his artistic legacy, and learning more about his life and work will enhance your understanding of the exhibition. Here are some book and documentary recommendations to get you started:

**Books:**

1. **Diego Rivera: The Complete Murals** by Luis-Martín Lozano and Juan Rafael Coronel Rivera ( Thames & Hudson, 2020) - This comprehensive book features high-quality reproductions of Rivera's murals, along with essays and commentary on his artistic development.
2. **Diego Rivera: A Biography** by Patrick Marnham (HarperCollins, 2000) - This biography provides a detailed and engaging account of Rivera's life, covering his early years, his time in Europe, and his return to Mexico.
3. **Diego Rivera: The Red Painter** by Juan Rafael Coronel Rivera (Rizzoli, 2018) - Written by Rivera's grandson, this book offers a personal and intimate perspective on the artist's life and work, featuring family archives and unpublished materials.

**Documentaries:**

1. **Diego Rivera: I Paint What I See** (1986) - This documentary explores Rivera's life and art, featuring interviews with the artist himself, as well as footage of his murals and studios.
2. **The Life and Times of Diego Rivera** (2003) - This PBS documentary covers Rivera's life, from his early years to his later work, featuring interviews with art historians, critics, and family members.
3. **Frida & Diego: A Musical History of Their Lives** (2014) - While not exclusively focused on Diego Rivera, this documentary explores the artistic and personal relationship between Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, featuring music, archival footage, and interviews.

**Additional resources:**

* The Diego Rivera Web Museum (diegorivera.org) - This online museum features a comprehensive collection of Rivera's artworks, including his murals, paintings, and drawings.
* The Museo Dolores Olmedo (museodoloresolmedo.org) - Located in Mexico City, this museum is dedicated to the art and legacy of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, and features an extensive collection of their works.

These resources will provide you with a deeper understanding of Diego Rivera's life, art, and contributions to Mexican Modernism. Enjoy your exploration of his work!
